com.facebook.buck.util

Class ProjectFilesystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.util.ProjectFilesystem

  • public class ProjectFilesystem
extends Object
    An injectable service for interacting with the filesystem relative to the project root.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ProjectFilesystem.CopySourceMode
      Controls the behavior of how the source should be treated when copying.

      ProjectFilesystem(Path projectRoot) 
      ProjectFilesystem(Path projectRoot, ImmutableSet<Path> ignorePaths)
      There should only be one ProjectFilesystem created per process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProjectFilesystem

        public ProjectFilesystem(Path projectRoot,
                 ImmutableSet<Path> ignorePaths)
        There should only be one ProjectFilesystem created per process.

        When creating a ProjectFilesystem for a test, rather than create a filesystem with an arbitrary argument for the project root, such as new File("."), prefer the creation of a mock filesystem via EasyMock instead. Note that there are cases (such as integration tests) where specifying new File(".") as the project root might be the appropriate thing.

      • ProjectFilesystem

        public ProjectFilesystem(Path projectRoot)

        public Optional<Reader> getReaderIfFileExists(Path pathRelativeToProjectRoot)

      • readFirstLine

        public Optional<String> readFirstLine(String pathRelativeToProjectRoot)
        Attempts to read the first line of the file specified by the relative path. If the file does not exist, is empty, or encounters an error while being read, Optional.absent() is returned. Otherwise, an Optional with the first line of the file will be returned. // @deprecated PRefero operation on Paths directly, replaced by readFirstLine(java.nio.file.Path)

      • readFirstLine

        public Optional<String> readFirstLine(Path pathRelativeToProjectRoot)
        Attempts to read the first line of the file specified by the relative path. If the file does not exist, is empty, or encounters an error while being read, Optional.absent() is returned. Otherwise, an Optional with the first line of the file will be returned.

      • readFirstLineFromFile

        public Optional<String> readFirstLineFromFile(Path file)
        Attempts to read the first line of the specified file. If the file does not exist, is empty, or encounters an error while being read, Optional.absent() is returned. Otherwise, an Optional with the first line of the file will be returned.
